title: Filing a chapter 13 will freeze my bank account?
question: I have direct deposit from my employer, if a file chap 13 will that affect it?
answers:
It is always a good idea to change banks to a bank where you do not owe any money to prior to filing bankruptcy. Sometimes the big banks will lockup some funds in your account until directed to release them by the trustee. Additionally credit unions will usually not let you bank with them after filing a bankruptcy since you caused them a loss.

Chapter 13 is a payment plan that should not impact your assets. However, it is a good question that before you file, you may want to ask your bank and evaluate what they tell you.

Wells Fargo has been known to freeze accounts upon filing bankruptcy arguing that the funds are now estate assets. Other banks may follow suit, but I rarely see it.

[This communication is intended as general information and not specific legal advice, and this communication does not create an attorney-client relationship.]

It shouldn't. If, however, you bank with the same institution that holds credit card debt that you want to discharge, then, not only can they "freeze" the account, they can also scoop the money out of the account under what the bankruptcy code calls a setoff or charge off.
